param-doc.name: skipWhitespace
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allow arbitrary insertion of whitespace characters in the subject. For instance, the contents amino acid matches the key aminoacid.

param-doc.name: trieSink
param-doc.p: If set, then writes the compiled dictionary to the specified file.

param-doc.name: wordStartCaseInsensitive
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allow case folding on the first character of each word.

param-doc.name: caseInsensitive
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allows case folding on all characters.

param-doc.name: allowJoined
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allow arbitrary suppression of whitespace characters in the subject. For instance, the contents aminoacid matches the key amino acid.

param-doc.name: targetLayer
param-doc.p: Name of the layer that contains the match annotations.

param-doc.name: trieSource
param-doc.p: If set, read the compiled dictionary from the specified file. Compiled dictionaries are usually faster for large dictionaries.

param-doc.name: skipConsecutiveWhitespaces
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allow the insertion of consecutive whitespace characters in the subject. For instance, the contents amino acid matches the entry amino acid.

param-doc.name: joinDash
param-doc.p: If set to true, then treat dash characters (-) as whitespace characters with regard to allowJoined. For instance, the contents aminoacid matches the entry amino-acid.

param-doc.name: multipleEntryBehaviour
param-doc.p: Specifies the behavior if the lexicon contains several entries with the same key.

param-doc.name: allUpperCaseInsensitive
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allow case folding on all characters in words that are all upper case.

param-doc.name: ignoreDiacritics
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allow dicacritic removal on all characters. For instance the contents acide amine matches the key acide amin√©.

param-doc.name: matchStartCaseInsensitive
param-doc.p: If set to true, then allow case folding on the first character of the entry key.

param-doc.name: substituteWhitespace
param-doc.p: If set to true, then all whitespace characters match each other (including '\n', '\r', '\t', and non-breaking spaces).
